error.signature: INFO: pip is looking at multiple versions of <package> to determine which version is compatible with other requirements. This could take a while.
error.regex: pip is looking at multiple versions|backtracking|This could take a while|Resolver is taking longer

verdict.summary: Pip's dependency resolver is backtracking through many version combinations to find a compatible set. Can take hours or appear to hang. Usually caused by loose version constraints, packages with many releases, or genuinely conflicting requirements.

dead_ends.action: Wait indefinitely for the resolver to finish
dead_ends.why_fails: Backtracking can be combinatorial; some dependency sets never resolve and pip will run for hours or days
Legacy resolver was removed in pip 24; even when available it silently installs incompatible versions

workarounds.action: Pin specific versions to reduce the search space: package==X.Y.Z
workarounds.how: Add explicit version pins for the packages pip is backtracking on, based on known-good combinations

workarounds.action: Use pip-compile (pip-tools) to pre-resolve dependencies offline
workarounds.how: pip install pip-tools && pip-compile requirements.in -o requirements.txt && pip install -r requirements.txt

workarounds.action: Use constraints file to limit version search space
workarounds.how: Create constraints.txt with known-good versions, then: pip install -c constraints.txt -r requirements.txt

leads_to.condition: when backtracking exhausts all options and finds no solution

preceded_by.condition: when Python version constraint eliminates many candidate versions

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Backtracking appears as pip hanging but is a resolver issue; timeout is a network connectivity issue during download
